meanings.sent1: The subcoriaceous leaves of the plant felt tough but slightly flexible.
meanings.sent2: The book cover had a subcoriaceous feel, similar to that of leather.
meanings.sent3: The subcoriaceous wallet looked like it was made of leather, but it was actually a plant-based material.
meanings.sent4: Her subcoriaceous skin was a shield against the harsh sun, like a layer of protective armor.
meanings.sent5: The subcoriaceous texture of the fabric made it durable and long-lasting.

meanings.definition: Having a texture resembling that of leather.
meanings.sent1: The subcoriaceous material of the bag mimicked the look and feel of real leather.
meanings.sent2: The chair upholstery had a subcoriaceous appearance, giving it a luxurious touch.
meanings.sent3: The subcoriaceous jacket fooled everyone into thinking it was genuine leather.
meanings.sent4: Her subcoriaceous gloves were like a second skin, providing both style and protection.
meanings.sent5: The subcoriaceous texture of the belt added a sophisticated touch to his outfit.
